fact_check_explanation_title: Nadhim Zahawi wrong to say Moderna booster protects against both Covid-19 and flu
fact_check_explanation_summary: The former minister for Covid vaccine deployment claimed that the Moderna booster protected against Covid-19 and flu.

fact_check_explanation_title: Image shared on social media doesn’t show BBC journalist pretending to be on the frontline of war in Ukraine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A single screenshot of a news report from March has led to claims that the BBC exaggerated the situation in Ukraine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Protestors did not close Bristol vaccination clinic ‘for the foreseeable future’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A group of protesters made a video claiming they ‘closed’ the centre. It reopened three days later.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence small boat arrivals beat NHS waiting lists
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims people arriving in small boats can beat the NHS waiting lists.

fact_check_explanation_title: Liz Truss’s 2022 Conservative party conference speech: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: We check five key claims from Ms Truss’s speech, including on tax, GP access and whether she was the first PM to attend a comprehensive school.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Bank of England hasn’t already spent £65 billion following mini-Budget
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the government had spent £65 billion have been shared extremely widely on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Kwasi Kwarteng wrong on ‘record unemployment’ under Labour
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Chancellor was wrong to say that Labour left office with record unemployment. During this period unemployment peaked below the record level, set in 1984.

fact_check_explanation_title: Article on impact of voice assistants on children is not ‘new research’
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article which suggests voice assistants may hinder children's cognitive and social development is not based on original research, and has been criticised by experts.

fact_check_explanation_title: Queen’s funeral was not cover-up for planning global recession
fact_check_explanation_summary: There’s no evidence to support a video claiming that the Queen did not die on 8 September, and that her funeral was a cover-up for world leaders to gather to …

fact_check_explanation_title: Do Treasury claims about a 'typical' first-time buyer’s savings add up?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve looked into the figures behind a tweet from the Treasury showing how the mini-Budget could benefit a hypothetical first-time buyer.

fact_check_explanation_title: Do the mini-Budget tax cuts favour the rich?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Income tax-payers across the income scale will benefit to some extent as a result of the Chancellor’s announcement—but higher earners will benefit much more.

fact_check_explanation_title: Bayer executive wrongly said mRNA vaccines are gene therapy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A spokesperson for Bayer said Stefan Oelrich’s comments were an ‘obvious slip of the tongue’.
